ahdr.header module¶

Module to convert parsed data from an Amira header into a set of nested objects. The key class is AmiraHeader.

Usage:

>>> from amira.header import AmiraHeader
>>> ah = AmiraHeader.from_file('file.am')
>>> print ah

Each nested object is constructed from the Block class defined.

There are four top-level attributes that every AmiraHeader will have: - designation - definitions - parameters - data_pointers

Each attribute can be queried using the attrs attribute.

>>> print ah.data_pointers.attrs
['data_pointer_1', 'data_pointer_2', 'data_pointer_3', 'data_pointer_4', 'data_pointer_5', 'data_pointer_6']
>>> print ah.data_pointers.data_pointer_1
data_pointer_1
pointer_name: VERTEX
data_format: None
data_dimension: 3
data_type: float
data_name: VertexCoordinates
data_index: 1
data_length: None

Data pointers are identified by the name data_pointer_n.

ahdr.header.main()[source]¶

ahdr.data_stream module¶

Extract and decode individual data streams from an Amira file Package the data stream as an image and contours by segment

>>> from amira_data_streams import get_streams
>>> data_streams = get_streams('file.am') # a valid .am file
>>> # data_streams is a dictionary of ``DataStreams`` having the ``data_index`` of the respective ``data_pointer`` as the key
>>> print data_streams[1]
data_pointer_1
pointer_name: Lattice
data_format: HxByteRLE
data_dimension: None
data_type: byte
data_name: Labels
data_index: 1
data_length: 299178
compressed size: 299178
uncompressed size: 16777216
